comments.body:
I think it'd be better to consolidate these, so that all enrichment methods for `T[A]` are on a single enrichment class, mostly in order to reduce the number of implicits in `cats.syntax.all`, but also just to simplify this code. In this case that would mean putting these methods on something named `ParallelTraversableOps` or `ParallelFoldMapAOps`, though, which also seems kind of bad.

I think for now this version is probably best, but we should definitely revisit this in Cats 3.

It's really unfortunate what we've done here (not youâ€”but us, the maintainers). `ParallelTraversableOps`, `ParallelTraversable_Ops`, `ParallelFlatTraversableOps`, `ParallelFoldMapAOps`, etc. could all be a single `ParallelFoldableOps` trait. As it is I guess we should go with what you've got here for consistency.
Totally nitpicking, the `_` in the class name is a bit unconventional in this code base. Normally it wouldn't be a big deal, we could always change it after, but we can't really in cats....
I kind of agree, but couldn't come up with a better name. Any suggestions?
My apologies, didn't realize it's coming from the method name.
